results.title: How Joe Manchin Left a Global Tax Deal in Limbo
results.abstract: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen’s signature achievement is in jeopardy if the United States cannot ratify the tax agreement that she brokered.
results.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley

multimedia.caption: Senator Joe Manchin III effectively scuttled the Biden administration’s tax agenda in Congress by saying he could not immediately support a climate, energy and tax package he had previously indicated he could support.

results.title: Extreme Heat Puts Life on Hold in Britain, a Land Not Built for It
results.abstract: In a country more accustomed to temperate weather, a brutal heat wave tested Britain’s infrastructure and forced millions to choose between a Stygian commute or a stifling home office.

multimedia.caption: Brighton, a seaside town an hour’s train ride from London, was a popular destination on Monday to try to escape the heat.

results.title: Plans to Fight Global Warming Face an Obstacle in Paris: Trees
results.abstract: As a new heat wave bakes the French capital and the rest of Europe, critics say that plans to make the city greener have led to the felling of trees essential to combating rising temperatures.

multimedia.caption: The lawns surrounding the Eiffel Tower have become the scene of furious protests over plans to cut down trees in the area as part of an effort to build a huge garden.

results.title: What Pregnancy and Childbirth Do to the Bodies of Young Girls
results.abstract: An Ohio 10-year-old’s recent abortion has generated fierce debate. Doctors in countries where pregnancy is common in adolescents say the toll of childbirth on young bodies is brutal.
